(Modl) derogative noun suffix indicating a negative or disapproving attitude towards the object
(Dir) go and; translocative verb prefix to indicate action performed at a distance from some reference point
(Loc) verb prefix indicating action on top of a surface or on the human back
(Adv) really, very; rare verb suffix indicating intensity of an action
(Pron) I, me; first person plural (noncontrol) subject/object verb prefix
(Conn) verb suffix occurring most commonly before suffixes deriving from auxiliaries or on complement clauses especially before -t
(Pron) you; second person singular (control) subject verb infix for stems of shape...VVCV
(Evid) verb suffix indicating past action deduced by the speaker from circumstantial evidence

(Asp) verb suffix indicating action performed over an extended period of time, either duratively or repetitively
